page.title: 13The ecology of Herm.
page.content: The mild winters and long hot summers of the Channel Islands attract an interesting variety of birds, flowers and butterflies. On cliffs and off-shore islets sea-birds nest, including many varities of gulls and a small colony of puffins. Many of the flowers are of Mediterranean origin and are unknown or scarce in the rest of the British Isles. The coastal habitat encourages such plants as sea holly and sea campion, while inland are many woodland, meadow and heathland plants. In the north is a common of accumulated shell-sand which provides a habitat for lime loving plants. Most popular is the Burnet Rose which covers large stretches of the common.
